summary: Political communication within the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks encompasses the strategies and methods employed by political entities to convey messages to the public and influence public opinion. This concept is crucial for understanding the dynamics of democracy and public safety in the EU, as it involves the dissemination of information that shapes political discourse. Regulatory measures may govern the transparency and accountability of such communications, ensuring that they adhere to principles of fairness and non-discrimination. Thus, political communication plays a vital role in fostering informed citizen engagement and maintaining the integrity of the political process within the EU.
